page.title: 02Lower Calbourne Mill
page.content: There was a mill on this site in the{Domesday Book.}It is not certain how old the present mill is. There was a fire in 1890 which destroyed the inside of the mill so the machinery inside dates from that time.The mill stopped working when in 1962 when the owner retired. The present owner,{Mr.John Pretty decided to start the mill working again in{1972. The corn is ground by two pairs of {millstones.}One pair is driven by a deisel engine,and the second pair is driven by an electric motor.There is insufficient water in the stream to keep the stones turning long enough to grind the corn required. That part of the machinery that shakes the corn down on to the mill stones is called a{millers damsel.}Mr. Pretty uses this as a trade name.
